content:
Dependencies
[1] Dropped jQuery.
[1] Upgraded from Popper v1.x to Popper v2.x.
[1] Replaced Libsass with Dart Sass as our Sass compiler given Libsass was
deprecated.
[1] Migrated from Jekyll to Hugo for building our documentation

tasks.content: Upgraded from Popper v1.x to Popper v2.x.
Migrated from Jekyll to Hugo for building our documentation

title: Browser support
content:
Browser support
[1] Dropped Internet Explorer 10 and 11
[1] Dropped Microsoft Edge < 16 (Legacy Edge)
[1] Dropped Firefox < 60
[1] Dropped Safari < 12
[1] Dropped iOS Safari < 12
[1] Dropped Chrome < 60
<hr class="my-5">

title: Documentation changes
content:
Documentation changes
[1] Redesigned homepage, docs layout, and footer.
[1] Added [new Parcel guide]({{< docsref "/getting-started/parcel" >}}).
[1] Added [new Customize section]({{< docsref "/customize/overview" >}}),
replacing
[v4's Theming page](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.6/getting-started/theming/),
with new details on Sass, global configuration options, color schemes, CSS
variables, and more.
[1] Reorganized all form documentation into [new Forms
section]({{< docsref "/forms/overview" >}}), breaking apart the content into
more focused pages.
[1] Similarly, updated [the Layout
section]({{< docsref "/layout/breakpoints" >}}), to flesh out grid content
more clearly.
[1] Renamed "Navs" component page to "Navs & Tabs".
[1] Renamed "Checks" page to "Checks & radios".
[1] Redesigned the navbar and added a new subnav to make it easier to get
around our sites and docs versions.
[1] Added new keyboard shortcut for the search field: <kbd><kbd>Ctrl</kbd> +
<kbd>/</kbd></kbd>.

tasks.content: Redesigned homepage, docs layout, and footer.

title: Sass
content:
Sass
[1] We've ditched the default Sass map merges to make it easier to remove
redundant values. Keep in mind you now have to define all values in the Sass
maps like `$theme-colors`. Check out how to deal with [Sass
maps]({{< docsref "/customize/sass#maps-and-loops" >}}).
[0] Renamed `color-yiq()` function and related variables to `color-contrast()`
as it's no longer related to YIQ color space.
[See #30168.](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/30168/)
[1] `$yiq-contrasted-threshold` is renamed to `$min-contrast-ratio`.
[1] `$yiq-text-dark` and `$yiq-text-light` are respectively renamed to
`$color-contrast-dark` and `$color-contrast-light`.
[0] Media query mixins parameters have changed for a more logical approach.
[1] `media-breakpoint-down()` uses the breakpoint itself instead of the next
breakpoint (e.g., `media-breakpoint-down(lg)` instead of
`media-breakpoint-down(md)` targets viewports smaller than `lg`).
[1] Similarly, the second parameter in `media-breakpoint-between()` also
uses the breakpoint itself instead of the next breakpoint (e.g.,
`media-breakpoint-between(sm, lg)` instead of
`media-breakpoint-between(sm, md)` targets viewports between `sm` and `lg`).
[0] Removed print styles and `$enable-print-styles` variable. Print display
classes are still around.
[See #28339](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/28339).
[0] Dropped `color()`, `theme-color()`, and `gray()` functions in favor of
variables. [See #29083](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/29083).
[0] Renamed `theme-color-level()` function to `color-level()` and now accepts
any color you want instead of only `$theme-color` colors.
[See #29083](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/29083) **Watch out:**
`color-level()` was later on dropped in `v5.0.0-alpha3`.
[0] Renamed `$enable-prefers-reduced-motion-media-query` and
`$enable-pointer-cursor-for-buttons` to `$enable-reduced-motion` and
`$enable-button-pointers` for brevity.
[0] Removed the `bg-gradient-variant()` mixin. Use the `.bg-gradient` class to
add gradients to elements instead of the generated `.bg-gradient-*` classes.
[0] **Removed previously deprecated mixins:**
[1] `hover`, `hover-focus`, `plain-hover-focus`, and `hover-focus-active`
[1] `float()`
[1] `form-control-mixin()`
[1] `nav-divider()`
[1] `retina-img()`
[1] `text-hide()` (also dropped the associated utility class, `.text-hide`)
[1] `visibility()`
[1] `form-control-focus()`
[0] Renamed `scale-color()` function to `shift-color()` to avoid collision
with Sass's own color scaling function.
[1] `box-shadow` mixins now allow `null` values and drop `none` from multiple
arguments. [See #30394](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/30394).
[1] The `border-radius()` mixin now has a default value.

tasks.content: The `border-radius()` mixin now has a default value.

title: Grid updates
content:
Grid updates
[1] **New breakpoint!** Added new `xxl` breakpoint for `1400px` and up. No
changes to all other breakpoints.
[1] **Improved gutters.** Gutters are now set in rems, and are narrower than
v4 (`1.5rem`, or about `24px`, down from `30px`). This aligns our grid
system's gutters with our spacing utilities.
[1] Added new [gutter class]({{< docsref "/layout/gutters" >}}) (`.g-*`,
`.gx-*`, and `.gy-*`) to control horizontal/vertical gutters, horizontal
gutters, and vertical gutters.
[0] Renamed `.no-gutters` to `.g-0` to match new gutter utilities.
[1] Columns no longer have `position: relative` applied, so you may have to
add `.position-relative` to some elements to restore that behavior.
[0] Dropped several `.order-*` classes that often went unused. We now only
provide `.order-1` to `.order-5` out of the box.
[0] Dropped the `.media` component as it can be easily replicated with
utilities. [See #28265](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/28265) and the
[flex utilities page for an
example]({{< docsref "/utilities/flex#media-object" >}}).
[0] `bootstrap-grid.css` now only applies `box-sizing: border-box` to the
column instead of resetting the global box-sizing. This way, our grid styles
can be used in more places without interference.
[1] `$enable-grid-classes` no longer disables the generation of container
classes anymore. [See #29146.](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/29146)
[1] Updated the `make-col` mixin to default to equal columns without a
specified size.

tasks.content: Renamed `.no-gutters` to `.g-0` to match new gutter utilities.

title: Content, Reboot, etc
content:
Content, Reboot, etc
[1] **[RFS]({{< docsref "/getting-started/rfs" >}}) is now enabled by
default.** Headings using the `font-size()` mixin will automatically adjust
their `font-size` to scale with the viewport. _This feature was previously
opt-in with v4._
[0] Overhauled our display typography to replace our `$display-*` variables
and with a `$display-font-sizes` Sass map. Also removed the individual
`$display-*-weight` variables for a single `$display-font-weight` and adjusted
`font-size`s.
[1] Added two new `.display-*` heading sizes, `.display-5` and `.display-6`.
[1] **Links are underlined by default** (not just on hover), unless they're
part of specific components.
[1] **Redesigned tables** to refresh their styles and rebuild them with CSS
variables for more control over styling.
[0] Nested tables do not inherit styles anymore.
[0] `.thead-light` and `.thead-dark` are dropped in favor of the `.table-*`
variant classes which can be used for all table elements (`thead`, `tbody`,
`tfoot`, `tr`, `th` and `td`).
[0] The `table-row-variant()` mixin is renamed to `table-variant()` and
accepts only 2 parameters: `$color` (color name) and `$value` (color code).
The border color and accent colors are automatically calculated based on the
table factor variables.
[1] Split table cell padding variables into `-y` and `-x`.
[0] Dropped `.pre-scrollable` class.
[See #29135](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/29135)
[0] `.text-*` utilities do not add hover and focus states to links anymore.
`.link-*` helper classes can be used instead.
[See #29267](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/29267)
[0] Dropped `.text-justify` class.
[See #29793](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/29793)
[0] ~~`<hr>` elements now use `height` instead of `border` to better support
the `size` attribute. This also enables use of padding utilities to create
thicker dividers (e.g., `<hr class="py-1">`).~~
[1] Reset default horizontal `padding-left` on `<ul>` and `<ol>` elements from
browser default `40px` to `2rem`.
[1] Added `$enable-smooth-scroll`, which applies `scroll-behavior: smooth`
globally—except for users asking for reduced motion through
`prefers-reduced-motion` media query.
[See #31877](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/31877)

tasks.content: Added two new `.display-*` heading sizes, `.display-5` and `.display-6`.
Nested tables do not inherit styles anymore.
Split table cell padding variables into `-y` and `-x`.

title: Forms
content:
Forms
[1] **Added new floating forms!** We've promoted the Floating labels example
to fully supported form components. [See the new Floating labels
page.]({{< docsref "/forms/floating-labels" >}})
[0] **Consolidated native and custom form elements.** Checkboxes, radios,
selects, and other inputs that had native and custom classes in v4 have been
consolidated. Now nearly all our form elements are entirely custom, most
without the need for custom HTML.
[1] `.custom-control.custom-checkbox` is now `.form-check`.
[1] `.custom-control.custom-radio` is now `.form-check`.
[1] `.custom-control.custom-switch` is now `.form-check.form-switch`.
[1] `.custom-select` is now `.form-select`.
[1] `.custom-file` and `.form-control-file` have been replaced by custom
styles on top of `.form-control`.
[1] `.custom-range` is now `.form-range`.
[1] Dropped native `.form-control-file` and `.form-control-range`.
[0] Dropped `.input-group-append` and `.input-group-prepend`. You can now just
add buttons and `.input-group-text` as direct children of the input groups.
[1] The longstanding
[Missing border radius on input group with validation feedback bug](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/25110)
is finally fixed by adding an additional `.has-validation` class to input
groups with validation.
[0] **Dropped form-specific layout classes for our grid system.** Use our grid
and utilities instead of `.form-group`, `.form-row`, or `.form-inline`.
[0] Form labels now require `.form-label`.
[0] `.form-text` no longer sets `display`, allowing you to create inline or
block help text as you wish just by changing the HTML element.
[1] Form controls no longer used fixed `height` when possible, instead
deferring to `min-height` to improve customization and compatibility with
other components.
[1] Validation icons are no longer applied to `<select>`s with `multiple`.
[1] Rearranged source Sass files under `scss/forms/`, including input group
styles.
<hr class="my-5">

tasks.content: Validation icons are no longer applied to `<select>`s with `multiple`.

title: Badges
content:
Badges
[0] Dropped all `.badge-*` color classes for background utilities (e.g., use
`.bg-primary` instead of `.badge-primary`).
[0] Dropped `.badge-pill`—use the `.rounded-pill` utility instead.
[0] Removed hover and focus styles for `<a>` and `<button>` elements.
[1] Increased default padding for badges from `.25em`/`.5em` to
`.35em`/`.65em`.

tasks.content: Removed hover and focus styles for `<a>` and `<button>` elements.

title: Buttons
content:
Buttons
[0] **[Toggle buttons]({{< docsref "/forms/checks-radios#toggle-buttons" >}}),
with checkboxes or radios, no longer require JavaScript and have new markup.**
We no longer require a wrapping element, add `.btn-check` to the `<input>`,
and pair it with any `.btn` classes on the `<label>`.
[See #30650](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/30650). _The docs for this
has moved from our Buttons page to the new Forms section._
[0] **Dropped `.btn-block` for utilities.** Instead of using `.btn-block` on
the `.btn`, wrap your buttons with `.d-grid` and a `.gap-*` utility to space
them as needed. Switch to responsive classes for even more control over them.
[Read the docs for some
examples.]({{< docsref "/components/buttons#block-buttons" >}})
[1] Updated our `button-variant()` and `button-outline-variant()` mixins to
support additional parameters.
[1] Updated buttons to ensure increased contrast on hover and active states.
[1] Disabled buttons now have `pointer-events: none;`.

tasks.content: Updated buttons to ensure increased contrast on hover and active states.

title: Close button
content:
Close button
[0] Renamed `.close` to `.btn-close` for a less generic name.
[1] Close buttons now use a `background-image` (embedded SVG) instead of a
`×` in the HTML, allowing for easier customization without the need to
touch your markup.
[1] Added new `.btn-close-white` variant that uses `filter: invert(1)` to
enable higher contrast dismiss icons against darker backgrounds.

tasks.content: Renamed `.close` to `.btn-close` for a less generic name.

title: Collapse
content:
Collapse
[1] Removed scroll anchoring for accordions.

title: Dropdowns
content:
Dropdowns
[1] Added new `.dropdown-menu-dark` variant and associated variables for
on-demand dark dropdowns.
[1] Added new variable for `$dropdown-padding-x`.
[1] Darkened the dropdown divider for improved contrast.
[0] All the events for the dropdown are now triggered on the dropdown toggle
button and then bubbled up to the parent element.
[1] Dropdown menus now have a `data-bs-popper="static"` attribute set when the
positioning of the dropdown is static, or dropdown is in the navbar. This is
added by our JavaScript and helps us use custom position styles without
interfering with Popper's positioning.
[0] Dropped `flip` option for dropdown plugin in favor of native Popper
configuration. You can now disable the flipping behavior by passing an empty
array for
[`fallbackPlacements`](https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/modifiers/flip/#fallbackplacements)
option in [flip](https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/modifiers/flip/) modifier.
[1] Dropdown menus can now be clickable with a new `autoClose` option to
handle the [auto close
behavior]({{< docsref "/components/dropdowns#auto-close-behavior" >}}). You
can use this option to accept the click inside or outside the dropdown menu to
make it interactive.
[1] Dropdowns now support `.dropdown-item`s wrapped in `<li>`s.

tasks.content: Darkened the dropdown divider for improved contrast.

title: Pagination
content:
Pagination
[1] Pagination links now have customizable `margin-left` that are dynamically
rounded on all corners when separated from one another.
[1] Added `transition`s to pagination links.

title: Popovers
content:
Popovers
[0] Renamed `.arrow` to `.popover-arrow` in our default popover template.
[1] Renamed `whiteList` option to `allowList`.

tasks.content: Renamed `.arrow` to `.popover-arrow` in our default popover template.

title: Spinners
content:
Spinners
[1] Spinners now honor `prefers-reduced-motion: reduce` by slowing down
animations. [See #31882](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/31882).
[1] Improved spinner vertical alignment.

title: Toasts
content:
Toasts
[1] Toasts can now be
[positioned]({{< docsref "/components/toasts#placement" >}}) in a
`.toast-container` with the help of [positioning
utilities]({{< docsref "/utilities/position" >}}).
[1] Changed default toast duration to 5 seconds.
[1] Removed `overflow: hidden` from toasts and replaced with proper
`border-radius`s with `calc()` functions.

tasks.content: Changed default toast duration to 5 seconds.

title: Tooltips
content:
Tooltips
[0] Renamed `.arrow` to `.tooltip-arrow` in our default tooltip template.
[0] The default value for the `fallbackPlacements` is changed to
`['top', 'right', 'bottom', 'left']` for better placement of popper elements.
[0] Renamed `whiteList` option to `allowList`.

tasks.content: Renamed `.arrow` to `.tooltip-arrow` in our default tooltip template.

title: Utilities
content:
Utilities
[0] Renamed several utilities to use logical property names instead of
directional names with the addition of RTL support:
[1] Renamed `.float-left` and `.float-right` to `.float-start` and
`.float-end`.
[1] Renamed `.border-left` and `.border-right` to `.border-start` and
`.border-end`.
[1] Renamed `.rounded-left` and `.rounded-right` to `.rounded-start` and
`.rounded-end`.
[1] Renamed `.ml-*` and `.mr-*` to `.ms-*` and `.me-*`.
[1] Renamed `.pl-*` and `.pr-*` to `.ps-*` and `.pe-*`.
[1] Renamed `.text-*-left` and `.text-*-right` to `.text-*-start` and
`.text-*-end`.
[0] Disabled negative margins by default.
[1] Added new `.bg-body` class for quickly setting the `<body>`'s background
to additional elements.
[1] Added new [position
utilities]({{< docsref "/utilities/position#arrange-elements" >}}) for `top`,
`right`, `bottom`, and `left`. Values include `0`, `50%`, and `100%` for each
property.
[1] Added new `.translate-middle-x` & `.translate-middle-y` utilities to
horizontally or vertically center absolute/fixed positioned elements.
[1] Added new [`border-width`
utilities]({{< docsref "/utilities/borders#border-width" >}}).
[0] Renamed `.text-monospace` to `.font-monospace`.
[0] Removed `.text-hide` as it's an antiquated method for hiding text that
shouldn't be used anymore.
[1] Added `.fs-*` utilities for `font-size` utilities (with RFS enabled).
These use the same scale as HTML's default headings (1-6, large to small), and
can be modified via Sass map.
[0] Renamed `.font-weight-*` utilities as `.fw-*` for brevity and consistency.
[0] Renamed `.font-italic` utility to `.fst-italic` for brevity and
consistency with new `.fst-normal` utility.
[1] Added `.d-grid` to display utilities and new `gap` utilities (`.gap`) for
CSS Grid and flexbox layouts.
[0] Removed `.rounded-sm` and `rounded-lg`, and introduced a new scale of
classes, `.rounded-0` to `.rounded-3`.
[See #31687](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/pull/31687).
[1] Added new `line-height` utilities: `.lh-1`, `.lh-sm`, `.lh-base` and
`.lh-lg`. See [here]({{< docsref "/utilities/text#line-height" >}}).
[1] Moved the `.d-none` utility in our CSS to give it more weight over other
display utilities.
[1] Extended the `.visually-hidden-focusable` helper to also work on
containers, using `:focus-within`.

tasks.content: Renamed `.font-weight-*` utilities as `.fw-*` for brevity and consistency.
